patchclampplotteR

Source: vignettes/patchclampplotteR.Rmd
patchclampplotteR.Rmd

How to use patchclampplotteR

This package is designed to help you import, analyze, and plot your patch clamp data efficiently. This vignette will walk you through a complete example of using patchclampplotteR to go from raw data to publication-quality plots!

library(patchclampplotteR)

About the data

This dataset consists of whole-cell patch clamp recordings of neurons within the dorsomedial hypothalamus (DMH), a brain region critical for appetite regulation, stress responses, thermoregulation, and other processes. I recorded evoked excitatory post-synaptic currents for five minutes under baseline conditions, then added 500 nM insulin to the perfusion solution, and I continued recording for 25 minutes. For more detail, please see the article “About the Data”

Import Data

My goal is to determine if insulin affects evoked current amplitude in DMH neurons.

First, I must import a csv file containing information about factors such as the animal’s age and sex, the cell ID number, and other details.

Note: Since this vignette uses a dataset included within an R package, the following code requires the function import_ext_data() to properly locate the csv file. For anyone using the package, you can likely just write the filename directly within import_cell_characteristics_df().

cell_characteristics <- import_cell_characteristics_df(import_ext_data("sample_cell_characteristics.csv"))

reactable(cell_characteristics, defaultPageSize = 5)
